snippet.textDisplay: I loved Devil May Cry 4, the originality of the soundtracks matched those of DMC 1. Darksiders 2 was also great. The God of War series also kicks ass with its music. So I guess any non-FPS game has great music potential. Oh yeah, and Capcom (also made DMC) are the best when you look at all their soundtracks.
snippet.textOriginal: I loved Devil May Cry 4, the originality of the soundtracks matched those of DMC 1. Darksiders 2 was also great. The God of War series also kicks ass with its music. So I guess any non-FPS game has great music potential. Oh yeah, and Capcom (also made DMC) are the best when you look at all their soundtracks.

snippet.textDisplay:
I think it's more because the 8-bit era was dominated by the big Japanese developers. I still think Nintendo (as an example) have some of the best music in their games (always have done and always will do).

Whereas this generation, Western developers are more prominent, and without hating on them, I just don't think they can create music as good as some of the best Japanese developers.
snippet.textOriginal:
I think it's more because the 8-bit era was dominated by the big Japanese developers. I still think Nintendo (as an example) have some of the best music in their games (always have done and always will do).

Whereas this generation, Western developers are more prominent, and without hating on them, I just don't think they can create music as good as some of the best Japanese developers.
